New Records: Kylian Mbappé scored his first goal at the European Championship.
Robert Lewandowski became the third player to score in four different editions of the UEFA European Championship, after Cristiano Ronaldo and Luka Modric.
France had 55 touches in Poland’s penalty area, the second-highest figure in any Euros match since 1980.
Key Match Events: The match ended in a 1-1 draw.
Poland equalized through a spot-kick, which was a turning point in the game.
Kylian Mbappé scored his first-ever goal at the tournament from the penalty spot.
Pre-Game Insights: France needed to win to finish top of Group D.
Kylian Mbappé was a key player despite a broken nose and his recovery from injury.
Poland had Robert Lewandowski back, giving them a boost after being eliminated earlier.
Post-Match Reflections: France finished second in their group, which was a concern for their tournament progression.
Poland avoided defeat despite being eliminated, with Robert Lewandowski scoring their consolation goal.
France's struggle to score in open play and their reliance on penalties were highlighted as areas of concern.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first time France failed to win their group at a major international tournament since Euro 2012.
Poland showed plenty of attacking intent but couldn't convert their chances.
Others: The match highlighted France's issues with open-play goals and their reliance on penalties.
The game ended with France and Poland both on the same side of the draw for the next stage.
